description: Dive into "Architectural Wonders of Udaipur" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Architectural Wonders of Udaipur

places.generalDescription: Jagdish Temple is a significant Hindu temple in Udaipur, dedicated to Lord Vishnu. The 16th-century structure showcases intricate carvings depicting ancient Hindu legends. Visitors can witness spiritual ceremonies conducted by Brahmins and devotees inside the temple. While entrance is free, donations are welcomed. Another notable temple in Udaipur is Mahakaleshwar Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva and located along the banks of Fateh Sagar Lake.

sources.snippet: Jagdish Temple: Inspired by the Indo-Aryan style of architecture, this 3-storied temple comprises of carved pillars, decorated ceilings, painted walls and lush halls. The spire or the shikhar is a noticeable feature festooned with sculptures of dancers, horsemen, elephants and musicians. The entrance is flanked by 2 huge stone elephants and a stone slab with inscriptions.
sources.shortName: Architecture of Udaipur, Architectural Features of Udaipur

sources.snippet: Located just outside the Royal Palace, Jagdish Temple is one of the most popular historical places in Udaipur. Established in the 17th century, this mammoth Hindu is dedicated to Lord Vishnu and is considered one of the most important shrines to Vishnu in the city. The Temple boasts of a flamboyant use of Indo-Aryan architectural style.
sources.shortName: 20 Historical Places in Udaipur

sources.snippet: Jagdish Temple, built in 1651, is one of the best historical places to visit in Udaipur. Dedicated to Lord Vishnu, this temple was commissioned by Maharana Jagat Singh, who ruled the region from 1628 till 1653. This three-storied shrine features Indo-Aryan architecture with finely decorated ceilings and beautifully carved pillars.
sources.shortName: Top 11 Historical Places in Udaipur in 2024 (Photos)

sources.snippet: This three-story temple is situated on a high platform and boasts wonderfully carved pillars, expansive, light-filled halls, and painted walls with bright decorations. Two enormous stone elephant sculptures have been placed at the entryway to greet guests. The stone slab at the entrance has writing etched on it.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Udaipur for Travelling Architect

places.name: Jagdish Temple

reviews.text:
Nestled right in the vibrant heart of Udaipur, Jagdish Temple is more than just a place of worship - it's a masterpiece of devotion, architecture, and history. The moment you step through its grand entrance, you are greeted by an atmosphere of peace that stands in sharp contrast to the bustling city streets just outside.

The temple's intricate carvings are simply mesmerizing, telling stories from ancient times with astonishing detail. Every pillar and corner showcases the remarkable craftsmanship of the artisans who built it nearly 400 years ago. As you climb the elegant marble steps, the energy shifts - it's almost as if time slows down to let you soak in the spiritual vibe.

The idol of Lord Vishnu (in the form of Jagannath) at the sanctum is stunning and radiates a serene, almost magnetic presence. Morning and evening aartis (prayer rituals) add an extra layer of magic to the experience, filling the temple with soulful chants and the fragrance of incense.

What truly sets Jagdish Temple apart is how seamlessly it blends into the life of Udaipur - it's a living, breathing part of the city's soul. Whether you're a devotee, a history lover, or simply an explorer seeking hidden gems, this temple promises a deeply enriching experience.

If you're in Udaipur, a visit to Jagdish Temple isn't just recommended - it's essential.

The Jagdish temple is a marvel - one climbs the steep steps to the initial courtyard and a lovely chap looks after your shoes for no more than 50R I think. We saw Ganesha first and walked round and then entered the Temple were devotees were chanting. The atmosphere was laid back and chill.

This famous temple offers a truly peaceful experience. Its ancient walls whisper tales of history, inviting you to step back in time and connect with a profound sense of serenity. A visit here is not just a sightseeing trip, but a journey for the soul, leaving you with a lasting sense of calm and reverence. Don't miss the opportunity to immerse yourself in its sacred atmosphere and rich heritage.

places.address: Old City, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

places.generalDescription: The City Palace in Udaipur, Rajasthan is a sprawling complex that houses the palaces of 11 different rulers. It stands tall above Lake Pichola and offers stunning lakeside views. The palace boasts a facade that stretches almost 250 meters in length and rises over 30 meters in height. Visitors can enter through the Baripol Gate or the Tripolia Gate, both dating back to the 17th and 18th centuries.

sources.snippet: The City Palace complex, constructed of granite and marble, is impressive for its flawless fusion of Chinese, European, and Medieval architecture. The complex‚Äôs several palaces are shown wonderfully behind the 100 feet high and 801 feet long facade that was expertly constructed on the Lake Pichola ridge. The 22 generations of Sisodia Rajputs constructed the City Palace complex, which is located at the height of 1,962 feet, over a protracted period of time beginning in the year 1559.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Udaipur for Travelling Architect

sources.snippet: The spectacular City Palace holds great historical importance as it once served as the administrative complex of the Maharanas of Udaipur. The construction of this beautiful palace was commissioned by Maharana Udai Singh II, and it was built for over 400 years by his successors. Standing tall in marble and granite, this building features a blend of Chinese, Medieval and European architectural styles.
sources.shortName: Top 11 Historical Places in Udaipur in 2024 (Photos)

sources.snippet: 22 generations of the Mewar dynasty contributed to the City Palace over nearly 400 years. Begun in 1559, the main fa√ßademeasures 244 meters (800 feet) in length and over 30 meters (100 feet) in height. Elevensmaller palaces plus assorted gateways and courtyards make it Rajasthan‚Äôs largest palace ‚Äì no minor accomplishmentconsidering the competition from the region‚Äôs other dynasties.
sources.shortName: The Architecture of Udaipur, India‚Äôs White City

sources.snippet: The City Palace, perched atop a hill overlooking the lake, is a stunning blend of courtyards, pavilions, terraces, corridors, rooms, and hanging gardens. Enclosed by fortified walls, the main entrance is through the triple-arched Tripolia gate, featuring eight marble porticos. The palace is currently home to two luxurious hotels, a school and the popular City Palace Museum.
sources.shortName: Historical Places Near Udaipur : Most Famous Historical Places in Udaipur

places.name: City Palace

reviews.text: Must visit if going to Udaipur, tickeys- 450/person, senior are 350 n students are 200/ person. Water bottle fillining facilites are outside entrance. Its a 3-4 hrs journey entry is from Mardana mahal. Showcasing all artellary of soldier, horse. King descendents. A artist is there to make live sketches. Securiry is good. View from palace is amazing, one side whole city othet side pichola lake. Description is given under every imp things there, Beautiful window gazing, sheesh mahal, painting, wedding hall, Queens palace musical instruments and memorial are well kept .Many places are beautifully restored. Maps of 1600s year and many of India is displayed. Dinning place is made inside. Do take some you water vottle with you and enjoy our culture and ancestory. Not much crowded in weekedays.

A beautiful palace and fort. Well maintained and has amazing glimpses of history.
It is well organised and has all basic facilities.
It has great art works within it and lots of pics spots.
The guides there are well mannered and explain well.
Cameras are allowed and so are phones.
You may have to walk a bit from ticket counter to the main palace, but try doing it, as it has good points on the way.
Takes around 4 hours for a complete visit well but you can spend a complete day in it too and not get bored.
Closed in the night.
Ample parking facility too.

One of the most beautiful palaces in India! The history here is truly remarkable. We booked tickets with a guide, and it made the whole experience really informative. Every section was a delight-the walls, paintings, and artifacts are absolutely stunning.
You can actually see the complete city from this palace!

places.address: Old City, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

places.generalDescription: Saheliyon ki Bari, a stunning garden in Udaipur, is renowned for its lush greenery, intricate marble art, and enchanting fountains. Built by the Maharana for the royal ladies of Mewar, it features four water pools, marble elephants, kiosks, and fountains. The garden also houses a museum displaying household items and pets of the residents.

sources.snippet: Saheliyon ki Bari | #4 of 11 Best Historical Places in Udaipur. Built in the 18 th century by Maharana Sangram Singh, Saheliyon ki Bari (or the Garden of the Maidens) is well-known for its beautiful fountains, lush lawns and marble structures. According to legends, the king himself had designed the plan of this garden for his beloved queen and the 48 maidens who accompanied her in marriage.
sources.shortName: Top 11 Historical Places in Udaipur in 2024 (Photos)

sources.snippet: Having its name literally translate to ‚ÄúGarden of the Maidens‚Äù, Saheliyon ki Bari is a historical garden at the heart of Udaipur. The garden was initially built by Raja Rana Sanga of Mewar as a gift for his Queen and her many maidens. One of the most popular historical places in Udaipur among couples, the garden is known for its quiet beauty.
sources.shortName: 20 Historical Places in Udaipur

sources.snippet: The Saheliyon Ki Bari is adorned with marble elephants, carved kiosks, and several fountains in each of its four swimming pools. The lotus lakes and bird fountains are two of the garden‚Äôs many notable features. One white marble kiosk in the middle and four black marble kiosks in each of the four corners adorn the garden‚Äôs central reservoir.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Udaipur for Travelling Architect

sources.snippet: Saheliyon ki Bari is another wonder with a concept built around needs of ladies. Chhatris and ponds are features implemented to provide shade and coolness for summers. The lush green lawns, marble arts and fountains present a green retreat to the dry land of Rajasthan.
sources.shortName: Architecture of Udaipur, Architectural Features of Udaipur

sources.snippet: Also known as the 'Garden of Friends', this lush green oasis was constructed as a retreat where the queen could unwind with her ladies. It features intricate marble arches and delightful fountains.
sources.shortName: Historical Places Near Udaipur : Most Famous Historical Places in Udaipur

places.name: Saheliyon ki bari

reviews.text:
We'd highly recommend visiting this place. It's incredibly well maintained and thoughtfully kept-honestly one of the most beautiful gardens we've been to. It's the kind of place where you can truly slow down and enjoy your time. The best part? It only costs ‚Çπ40 per person, which is a total steal for how serene and pretty it is.

Yes, like many public spaces, some people still litter-but the staff here does a great job cleaning up and preserving the beauty of the space.

This part isn't just about the garden, but we feel it needs to be said: even if you have a small platform, use it to spread the message. Please be responsible when you're out in public. Carry a small bag, collect your trash, and dispose of it properly. It's such a small thing, but it makes a huge difference.

Happy holidaying-and let's keep our shared spaces beautiful.

One of the beautiful and serene place in the heart of Udaipur city. The greenery of the garden and multiple non-stop fountains add more charm to the place.
One can easily spend time here strolling around the garden and admiring it's beauty. The place is well maintained by the government. There is small entrance fee which can be taken at the entrance itself.

"Beautiful Garden of Udaipur ‚Äì Saheliyon Ki Bari"

Saheliyon Ki Bari is a truly beautiful and refreshing place to visit in Udaipur. The garden is well-maintained with lush greenery, lotus ponds, fountains, and marble pavilions that reflect the royal charm of the city. üå∏üíß

It's very peaceful to walk around here, and the historic design gives a glimpse of how the royal ladies once spent their leisure time. The fountains, especially when running, make the whole place feel magical.

A perfect spot for photography, relaxation, and enjoying nature in the heart of the city. Definitely worth a visit!

places.address: Panchwati, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

places.generalDescription: Lake Pichola, an artificial freshwater lake in Udaipur, Rajasthan, offers boat rides and is home to several islands with palaces. Built in 1362, it was initially intended to meet the city's water and irrigation needs. The lake has four islands including Arsi villa & Jag Niwas, which houses a small palace and a sanctuary for bird watching.

sources.snippet: Maharana Udai Singh was so mesmerized by the alluring lake that he founded the city of Udaipur right there on its shores. By constructing a dam on the lake‚Äôs edge, Maharana Udai Singh is credited with significantly increasing the lake. The lake‚Äôs environs thereafter saw the development of a number of islands, palaces, temples, residences, and bathing ghats over time, enhancing its allure.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Udaipur for Travelling Architect

sources.snippet: The foundation of this city follows as per the legend when Maharana Udai Singh met a holy man overlooking Lake Pichola and he blessed and advised him to build a palace near the fertile valley watered by lake within the mountains. Maharana followed his advise and founded the city in 1559 A.D.
sources.shortName: Architecture of Udaipur, Architectural Features of Udaipur

sources.snippet: Surrounded by majestic temples and palaces in the heart of the city, the captivating vistas that this enchanting man-made lake offers are a sight to behold!
sources.shortName: Historical Places Near Udaipur : Most Famous Historical Places in Udaipur

places.name: Lake Pichola

reviews.text:
Lake Pichola in Udaipur feels like something out of a dream. The beauty of the lake, with the mountains and palaces around it, is just magical. You can enter from the City Palace side, where you need to buy a ticket for the boat ride. The boat ride is one of the best experiences you can have - the calm water, the cool breeze, and the amazing view of old buildings and the sunset make it unforgettable.

The boat also stops at Jag Mandir, which is a beautiful place to walk around and click some great pictures. The only thing I didn't like was the food at Jag Mandir - it's way too expensive. But apart from that, Lake Pichola is truly a place that feels like another world. A must-visit when you are in Udaipur!
One of my favourite place. ‚ù§Ô∏è beautiful lakes surroundings hills. City palace mesmerizing view .I was staying nearby hotel and enjoyed a lot

Sunset here feels like a dream with the water reflecting the changing colors of the sky

Built in the 14th century, this lake surrounds beautiful palaces that seem to float. Boat rides are amazing, but ticket prices could be more affordable

places.address: Pichola, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001

sources.snippet: Kitchen: The most well ventilated space was the kitchen since the food was cooked in chulhas. Stone slabs were inserted in depressions of walls to act as a storage area.
sources.shortName: Architecture of Udaipur, Architectural Features of Udaipur

reviews.text: Kraft Kitchen did an amazing job on our modular kitchen! The design, quality, and functionality exceeded our expectations. Special thanks to Mr. Kuldeep for his personal involvement and dedication to ensuring everything was perfect. Highly recommend their professional and efficient service!

Owner Kuldeep ji is very soft spoken and understand the design of the kitchen very well. On the sight he immediately understand my need and agreed to my design. Quality of the kitchen material was excellent and he also advised to select the colour of the laminates.overall design, layout, product, quality, service was excellent with reasonable price and timely installation and service.I highly  recommend to go with his services. *****üëçüëç
Owner is very humble and genuine person who understands the kitchen desire proper and make best with great effort. Products are very good and quality wise best.

places.address: Craft kitchen, Main, University Rd, Near A-One School, Ayad, Ganapati Nagar, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

places.generalDescription: Sajjangarh Monsoon Palace, also known as Monsoon Mahal, is a stunning white marble palace perched on a high hill in Udaipur. Built by Maharana Sajjan Singh of the Mewar Dynasty, this palace offers breathtaking panoramic views of Fatehsagar Lake and the surrounding countryside.

sources.snippet: Also known as Monsoon Palace, Sajjangarh Palace is located at a peak Bansdara Mountain as high as about 944 m above the sea level overlooking the famous Pichola Lake. This palace is also known Monsoon Palace because it was used as summer retreat for Mewar Kings and also as a Monsoon Palace, to watch the progress of Monsoon clouds. Timings: 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM (all days of the week)Entry Fee: INR 100 (Indians) and INR 335 (Foreigners), INR 100 (Vehicle Entry)Location: 11 Monsoon Colony, Sajjan Garh Road, Udaipur.
sources.shortName: 8 Beautiful Palaces in Udaipur to Visit (2024)

sources.snippet: Nestled amidst the rolling green Aravallis, Sajjangarh Palace served as Maharana Sajjan Singh‚Äôs palatial residence. Located at an elevation of over 3,000 feet above sea level, the Palace was frequented by the royal family during the monsoon season to witness the passing clouds, giving it the name of ‚ÄòMonsoon Palace‚Äô. The Palace is known for its exquisite architectural styles, with marble structures, domes, jharokha and well-kept gardens adding a regal beauty to the place.
sources.shortName: 20 Historical Places in Udaipur

sources.snippet: Also known as Sajjangarh Palace, the Monsoon Palace is made of magnificent white marble, situated on a Bandara peak of the Aravalli range, which rises 3100 feet above sea level. The marble pillars that support the Fort‚Äôs foundation are intricately carved with floral and leafy designs. Lime mortar was used for plastering the palace walls.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Udaipur for Travelling Architect

sources.snippet: Sajjangarh Palace | #7 of 11 Best Historical Places in Udaipur. The 19 th-century Sajjangarh Palace is one of the most prominent historical places in the city of Udaipur. Built by Maharana Sajjan Singh in 1884, this palace was initially used as an astronomical centre but later, it was also used as a hunting lodge and monsoon palace.
sources.shortName: Top 11 Historical Places in Udaipur in 2024 (Photos)

places.name: Monsoon Palace

reviews.text:
The calm and view of sunset just touched my soul. This palace in udaipur truly made my day. I am silhouette lover and sunset is the soul for a silhouette. This palace is totally made for the sunset view. I visited here in march end week and I missed the sunset view from the karni mata mandir. But caught the full üåá sunset view at this palace.

The price can be feel bit high but truly worth it. Here, you can go by your own vehicle or by buying ticket for car service that will provide take and drop service.

Note: If you took their vehicle service don't lost the ticket as the contact details are written on the ticket only. So , if you missed the last car while enjoying till bit late. So you can contact them and they will come to pick you. But try to come back till 6pm last after that you will not get auto or any online service as this place is far from local areas.

The Monsoon Palace is less about grandeur and more about atmospheric beauty-a place where history, nature, and romance come together under dramatic skies. While the structure itself is modest, the views are unforgettable-especially during sunset or after the monsoon rains. It's a must-visit for anyone seeking a tranquil, picture-perfect escape with a touch of royal nostalgia.

Absolutely breathtaking! The Monsoon Palace offers one of the most stunning panoramic views of Udaipur ‚Äì lakes, hills, and the city all spread out beautifully below. The view from the top is unforgettable, especially during the monsoon season when the greenery comes alive.

The drive up to the palace is equally scenic, with winding roads and lush landscapes that make the journey as enjoyable as the destination. Clouds drifting by, cool breeze, and light rain ‚Äì it's truly magical.

If you're in Udaipur during the rains, this is a must-visit spot. The combination of nature, views, and peaceful vibes make it a perfect escape.

places.address: Udaipur, Kodiyat, Rajasthan 313031, India

They use uniformity in project spectrum while incorporating sustainable initiatives such as green roofs into their designs.

sources.snippet: If you want your building to be one of a kind and look mesmerizing and charming not just from a distance but also from inside, the Priyanka Arjun Associates is the right choice of architects for you and your project. After all, architecture is a visual art and Priyanka Arjun Associates are a master at performing this art. This organization concentrates on designing ecological and social buildings which create an impact on environment and touches lifestyles of people.

They work on all types of sustainable resort, luxury hotels and multi storey apartments with uniform and whole project spectrum. Complete design solutions which include Interiors, Graphics, Architecture and Landscape are offered by this firm.

From architecture to interior design solutions the firm offers all under a single roof. Known for incorporating sustainable initiatives in their projects, PAA deals in making of Udaipur‚Äôs vernacular ‚Äòlime-stone buildings‚Äô.

reviews.text: Priyanka Arjun & Associates is committed towards creating something different both in architecture and interior. They take a deep understanding of the clients requirement and gives attention to each minute detail. They create a meaningful balance between traditional and contemporary design which are long lasting. I am glad that i chose them as the designers for my house. kudos and best of luck to the entire team.

The creation of building plans for my resort was par excellence, out of the box and not a run of the mill creation. Indeed a quality architect's work. Priyanka Arjun and Associates deserves accolades for the brilliant work they delivered. Quality, precision and professionalism to the helm.

Priyanka Arjun and Associates has delivered well conceptualised designs and executed projects with strict approach on time and budget. Excellent team of professionals work together to make your dream come true. Definitely recommended.

places.address: Priyanka Arjun and Associates 11/O, near Orbit 1 Apt, Saheli Nagar, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

places.generalDescription: Kapil Jain Architects is an architecture company that provides high-quality services while keeping the client in mind. They are experts in interior design, project management, and architectural services and can provide a tailored solution for your specific needs. Their belief is that good architecture should compliment the local style and evoke spirit of place while conveying a timeless quality. I have used Kapil Jain Architects' services, and I can attest to their expertise in both designing buildings and overseeing them on-site.

sources.snippet: Kapil Jain Architects is a client centered company so they offer effective services keeping in mind to give optimum satisfaction to the client. Services rendered by them are Interior Designing, Project Management, Interior Turnkey Projects, Architectural Services, Structure Designing, Municipal Liaisoning, etc. It‚Äôs their belief that architecture should compliment the local style, evoke spirit of place and convey a timeless quality.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Architects in Udaipur

places.name: Kapil Jain Architects

reviews.text:
It is an absolute pleasure working with Mr. Kapil Jain. He is very honest and professional.     He and his team is well organized and clear on the  customer's expectations. He is very Quick and concise in his communication. Explores and provides options before final design. Very Innovative and professional staff.
He exceeded my expectation. Highly recommended.

Our construction company used Kapil Jain Architects to develop a number projects, I always found him and his team to be highly professional in the execution of their role. Architect Kapil Jain was also thought provoking when we were designing the schemes, incorporating renewable energies unique design features. I have no hesitation recommending  Kapil Jain and look forward to having the opportunity to work with him again.

Kapil Jain Architects are a professional team. They have knowledge experience and connections. They are pro active. We do not have to chase them for updated or information. They create value through design and save cost through efficiency.

places.address: 2-A, 1st Floor, Residency Rd, opposite Monalisa Studio, near Sardarpura, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

places.generalDescription: Ghantaghar, also known as Clock Tower, is a bustling market area near Jagadish Chowk in the heart of the city. The shops here offer a wide array of handicrafts, designer jewelry such as meenakari and Kundan works, antique silver gems, and traditional Rajasthani turbans with intricate embroidery. Visitors can also find colorful tapestries, decorated idols of Hindu deities, copperwares, metal assortments, and earthenware.

sources.snippet: Most cities in Rajasthan have an iconic clock tower at the heart of the city, and Udaipur is no different. The clock tower, or ghanta ghar as it is locally known, was built by the royal family of Mewar in the year 1887. The tower serves as an important landmark in the city.
sources.shortName: 20 Historical Places in Udaipur

places.name: Ghantaghar

reviews.text: An old clock tower In the local market. We can see beautiful architecture of acian times of india here. We can see how beautifully it was made. Clocks were brought from London and It was the first public clock of the city and was built as a souvenir of the royal family of mevad. We can see here that a clock tower can also be a beautiful place.

This is the place for shopping in Udaipur the original working art of craftsmanship of lether and cloth juti,bangles,pagdi etc etc

places.generalDescription: Harit Haveli Thikana Restaurant, located in Udaipur City, is known for its delectable food and excellent service. The restaurant offers a breathtaking view and has gained popularity among locals and tourists alike. The establishment can be found at C/O Hotel The Archi on 61-A, Udaipur City, near New Fatehpura and Sukhadia Circle. It also boasts a phone number +912942422509.

sources.snippet: Haveli: A unique architectural style that evolved around the concept of courtyards is haveli. The courtyard in olden times was used for womenfolks and as their leisure area and sometimes even an open kitchen or garden. To fortify this area, the courtyard was capsuled with rooms and seating areas on the three sides except at the entrance which had its own level of security.
sources.shortName: Architecture of Udaipur, Architectural Features of Udaipur

Value for money

places.generalDescription: Dudh Talai, also known as the Pond of Milk, is a small lake located at the south-eastern end of Lake Pichola in the city of lakes. This 371-acre artificial pond offers boat tours and is surrounded by lush hills, providing a picturesque setting. The area was once a grazing ground for cows that provided milk to the regal families, hence its name.

sources.snippet: The Dudh Talai Musical Garden is the ideal illustration of modern Rajasthani architecture. Along with Manikya Lal Verma Garden, Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay Park, and Karni Mata Temple, Dudh Talai Musical Garden is one of the lake‚Äôs three main attractions. It is surrounded by little hillocks.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Udaipur for Travelling Architect

places.name: Dudh Talai

reviews.text:
This is a small lake right on the side of Pichola.
Nothing extraordinary about this place. You can come here in the morning when you've heading for the Sunrise view from the Karni mata temple as it's on the foothills of Karni mata temple.
You get the the best pictures with the best view
Beautiful view of Lake pichola with some beautiful places middle of it..Have a temple nearby.we can climb there or use Cable car.Apt for Boat riding and photoshoots

Great place for tourists, one of those places of Udaipur where you can enjoy and chill at noon even in summers, but I highly recommend going here in the evening to watch the sunset and experience the boating ride at 180rs price I think it's worth it

places.generalDescription: Livspace Designs is a Bengaluru-based architectural, interior designing and Vastu consultancy firm that specializes in conceptual and thematic interior design as well as exterior designing. The firm has an impressive portfolio of projects, including the designs of offices at Mangalam Fun Square in Udaipur and interiors at Everest Group in Udaipur. Their work is characterized by luxurious style and attention to detail, making them a top choice for those looking for high-quality interior design services.

sources.snippet: LIVSPACE Designs is an architectural, interior designing and Vastu consultancy firm that provides conceptual and thematic interior as well as exterior designing.
